title: Simple tomato salad
portion: Serves 10 as part of a buffet
time: Takes 20 minutes to make, plus marinating
description: Keeping it classic? This is a simple tomato salad recipe made with a homemade herb salt and simple olive oil dressing.
ingredients: 1.8kg ripe tomatoes (as many different colours, shapes and sizes as you can find – look out for heritage tomatoes at farmers’ markets and some supermarkets)
a small handful fresh thyme leaves
a small handful fresh rosemary leaves
a handful of fresh basil leaves

method.Step 1: Slice the tomatoes into rounds or bite-size pieces. In a bowl, whisk the olive oil with the red wine vinegar and black pepper. Finely chop the thyme and rosemary leaves, add to a pestle and mortar, then crush with the coarse sea salt.

method.Step 2: Toss half the dressing and half the herb salt through the tomatoes, then leave to marinate for 30 minutes or so.

method.Step 3: Layer the tomatoes and the fresh basil leaves in a serving bowl, drizzling as you go with the rest of the dressing and herb salt. Serve.
